messages.message: Hi Team. I propose we add pyupgrade (https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade/tree/main) to our precommit hooks to  automatically upgrade our python syntax to modern standards. Does anyone have any objections?

Not an objection, but this would lead to bigger PRs until there are no more syntax changes to be made in the codebase.
Also, do you see a possibility of it leading to syntax errors?
The syntax transformations it does are all syntactically equivalent. We will have to manually remove imports for deprecated type aliases (ie. `typing.List`, `typing.Text`, `typing.Dict`, etc. )
Also, are there any folders that we should exclude from this (I'm assuming `public-lib` and `sdk`).
